uizalivestream.uiza.rtplibrary.base

Class DisplayBase

  • java.lang.Object
    • uizalivestream.uiza.rtplibrary.base.DisplayBase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GetAacData, GetMicrophoneData, GetH264Data
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RtmpDisplay, RtspDisplay

    public abstract class DisplayBase
extends java.lang.Object
implements GetAacData, GetH264Data, GetMicrophoneData
    Wrapper to stream display screen of your device and microphone. Can be executed in background.

    API requirements: API 21+.

    Created by pedro on 9/08/17.

    • Method Detail

      • setAuthorization

        public abstract void setAuthorization(java.lang.String user,
                                      java.lang.String password)
        Basic auth developed to work with Wowza. No tested with other server
        Parameters:
        user - auth.
        password - auth.

      • prepareVideo

        public boolean prepareVideo(int width,
                            int height,
                            int fps,
                            int bitrate,
                            int rotation,
                            int dpi)
        Call this method before use @startStream. If not you will do a stream without video.
        Parameters:
        width - resolution in px.
        height - resolution in px.
        fps - frames per second of the stream.
        bitrate - H264 in kb.
        rotation - could be 90, 180, 270 or 0 (Normally 0 if you are streaming in landscape or 90 if you are streaming in Portrait). This only affect to stream result. This work rotating with encoder. NOTE: Rotation with encoder is silence ignored in some devices.
        dpi - of your screen device.
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a H264 encoder).

      • prepareAudioRtp

        protected abstract void prepareAudioRtp(boolean isStereo,
                                        int sampleRate)

      • prepareAudio

        public boolean prepareAudio(int bitrate,
                            int sampleRate,
                            boolean isStereo,
                            boolean echoCanceler,
                            boolean noiseSuppressor)
        Call this method before use @startStream. If not you will do a stream without audio.
        Parameters:
        bitrate - AAC in kb.
        sampleRate - of audio in hz. Can be 8000, 16000, 22500, 32000, 44100.
        isStereo - true if you want Stereo audio (2 audio channels), false if you want Mono audio (1 audio channel).
        echoCanceler - true enable echo canceler, false disable.
        noiseSuppressor - true enable noise suppressor, false disable.
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a AAC encoder).

      • prepareVideo

        public boolean prepareVideo()
        Same to call: rotation = 0; if (Portrait) rotation = 90; prepareVideo(640, 480, 30, 1200 * 1024, true, 0);
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a H264 encoder).

      • prepareAudio

        public boolean prepareAudio()
        Same to call: prepareAudio(128 * 1024, 44100, true, false, false);
        Returns:
        true if success, false if you get a error (Normally because the encoder selected doesn't support any configuration seated or your device hasn't a AAC encoder).

      • setForce

        public void setForce(CodecUtil.Force forceVideo,
                     CodecUtil.Force forceAudio)
        Parameters:
        forceVideo - force type codec used. FIRST_COMPATIBLE_FOUND, SOFTWARE, HARDWARE
        forceAudio - force type codec used. FIRST_COMPATIBLE_FOUND, SOFTWARE, HARDWARE

      • startRecord

        public void startRecord(java.lang.String path)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Start record a MP4 video. Need be called while stream.
        Parameters:
        path - where file will be saved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If you init it before start stream.

      • stopRecord

        public void stopRecord()
        Stop record MP4 video started with @startRecord. If you don't call it file will be unreadable.

      • startStreamRtp

        protected abstract void startStreamRtp(java.lang.String url)

      • sendIntent

        public android.content.Intent sendIntent()
        Create Intent used to init screen capture with startActivityForResult.
        Returns:
        intent to startActivityForResult.

      • startStream

        public void startStream(java.lang.String url,
                        int resultCode,
                        android.content.Intent data)
        Need be called after @prepareVideo or/and @prepareAudio.
        Parameters:
        url - of the stream like: protocol://ip:port/application/streamName

        RTSP: rtsp://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94 RTSPS: rtsps://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94 RTMP: rtmp://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94 RTMPS: rtmps://192.168.1.1:1935/live/pedroSG94
